meanings.definition: The quality or state of being quick or fast.
meanings.sent1: Her quicknesses in running helped her win the race.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah's speed and quicknesses make it a formidable hunter.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit's quicknesses in dodging the fox's pounce saved its fluffy tail.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by with the quicknesses of a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The quicknesses of the hummingbird's wings were a blur of motion.

meanings.definition: The ability to move or react swiftly.
meanings.sent1: His quicknesses in basketball made him a valuable player on the team.
meanings.sent2: The ninja's agility and quicknesses allowed him to evade his enemies effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's quicknesses in gathering nuts amazed the other forest animals.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked with the quicknesses of a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The quicknesses of the cat's reflexes were on full display as it caught the mouse.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being prompt or speedy.
meanings.sent1: The courier's quicknesses in delivering packages made him popular with customers.
meanings.sent2: In emergencies, the paramedics' quicknesses can make a life-saving difference.
meanings.sent3: The chef's quicknesses in preparing meals impressed the restaurant patrons.
meanings.sent4: The quicknesses of the internet allow information to travel across the globe in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The quicknesses of the athlete's response to the starting gun determined the race's outcome.
